translation.en: [boy snarling] No! No!
[woman] I'm your mother.
-[woman speaking indistinctly] -[boy yelling] Don't do that! -[woman speaking indistinctly] -[boy laughs evilly]
[man 1] What we have here is a confrontation between good and evil,
and the place that evil picked was Connecticut.
My name is David Glatzel.
When I was 11, I was possessed by the devil.
A bizarre murder trial gets underway tomorrow in Danbury, Connecticut.
translation.ko: 내일 코네티컷주 댄버리에서 기묘한 살인 사건 재판이 열립니다

translation.en: The crux of this case is a claim of demonic possession.
translation.ko: 이 사건의 핵심은 바로 악귀에 씌었다는 주장이죠

translation.en: That's what an attorney for a Connecticut teenager will try to prove.
translation.ko: 코네티컷주 십 대의 변호인이 그걸 증명할 예정입니다

translation.en: [man 2] I said, "Why am I here?"
translation.ko: "브룩필드 경찰서" 내가 왜 여기 있는지 물었더니 내가 친구를 죽였다더군요

translation.en: And he said, "Well, you just killed your friend."
translation.ko: 내가 왜 여기 있는지 물었더니 내가 친구를 죽였다더군요

translation.en: [newscaster 1] A man who was arrested last month in Connecticut for murder
says that he will plead innocent
because he was possessed by the devil at the time he committed the crime.
translation.ko: 범죄를 저질렀을 때 악귀에 씌었었기 때문이라고 하죠

translation.en: Are you kidding?
There was drinking. There was a stabbing.
This is an open-shut case. This is ridiculous.
[newscaster 2] The tale really begins in the house at the end of this driveway,
translation.ko: 이 진입로 끝에 있는 집에서 이야기가 시작됩니다

translation.en: where the Brookfield couple
whose 11-year-old son began acting strangely.
translation.ko: 브룩필드에 사는 부부의 11살 된 아들이 이상하게 굴기 시작한 거죠

translation.en: -[possessed David growling] -[woman] Get up!
[David] I don't like to be remembered as the 11-year-old boy that was possessed…
[possessed David] You will die!
…but I gotta deal with it every day.
[young man] You can't hurt God's child. [possessed David] Jesus is gonna die in hell.
translation.ko: - 주님의 아이는 해치지 못한다 - 예수는 지옥에서 죽을 거야

translation.en: I have never spoken to anybody about this.
It's a secret, a dark secret.
[people praying] Our Father, who art in heaven…
Give us this day our daily bread…
-[possessed David breathing] -[people continue praying]
[possessed David] You're gonna die!
[people] Amen.
[David] I would love to tell you my story
about the possession and the murder
and Arne Johnson.
I'd like to make sure my family is portrayed
with the accuracy that it should be.
I know some people have fabricated some stories,
and I'm not happy with that, so I'd like to set the record straight.
translation.ko: 제대로 된 사실이 아니라 바로잡고 싶어요

translation.en: [David] When I was 11 years old, I was quiet.
Life was good.
Playing with my brothers, best time of my life.
translation.ko: 형들과 놀면서 정말 좋은 시간을 보냈어요

translation.en: [man] I was the middle child of the boys.
Typical middle-child syndrome.
I have an older brother, Carl.
He… [sighs] …was not the easiest brother to go along with.
He was kind of like an idiot at times.
Made life difficult.
Alan, back in the day, was just different.
translation.ko: 앨런은 그때 "칼 글래츨 데이비드의 맏형" 좀 달랐어요

translation.en: David and I would help my father and work in the garage and stuff.
translation.ko: 데이비드와 저는 아버지를 도와 차고에서 일했는데

translation.en: And Alan really didn't want to get dirty,
so he stayed with my mother most of the time.
You know, he could bake a good cake. I can tell you that much.
translation.ko: 케이크 하나는 잘 만들었죠 그건 확실해요

translation.en: But, uh, he's just a little different than us.
[David] Back then, I wouldn't call us an all-American family,
translation.ko: 그때 우리는 전형적인 미국 가정은 아니었지만

translation.en: but I would say we were as normal as we can be.
It all started when my sister, Debbie, found a house in Newtown.
translation.ko: 사건은 데비 누나가 뉴타운에 집을 구하면서 시작됐어요

translation.en: She was going to move in with her boyfriend, Arne.
translation.ko: 남자 친구인 아니와 같이 살 계획이었죠

translation.en: Debbie and I were very excited to move in together.
translation.ko: 데비와 전 같이 살 생각에 들떠 있었어요 "아니 샤이엔 존슨 데비의 남자 친구"

translation.en: We had plans on being married in the spring.
translation.ko: "아니 샤이엔 존슨 데비의 남자 친구" 봄에 결혼할 계획을 세우고

translation.en: We were working towards that.
We couldn't wait. We couldn't wait.
July 2nd, Debbie found a really nice house in Newtown to rent.
translation.ko: 7월 2일에 데비가 뉴타운에서 좋은 월세 집을 찾았어요

translation.en: [David] I was a little sad to see them move out.
You're 11 years old, it's your sister.
Me and my older brothers, Alan and Carl, ended up going there to help them move in.
translation.ko: 저와 앨런 형, 칼 형이 이사를 도와주러 거기 갔어요

translation.en: It was a weird house.
There was just something really off about it.
[Debbie] I assigned each of my brothers a chore.
I sent David into the master bedroom,
and handed him a broom and asked him if he could sweep up for me.
translation.ko: "데비 글래츨 데이비드의 누나, 2005년" 쓸어 달라고 부탁했죠

translation.en: I left him in there alone.
And then I started doing what I had to do, scouring and cleaning.
translation.ko: 그러고 나서 박박 닦고 청소하며 저도 할 일을 시작했어요

translation.en: But after a while, David came running out.
He looked upset, and I didn't know why.
translation.ko: 감정이 격한 것 같았는데 이유를 몰랐죠

translation.en: [Alan] David said, "Mom, I wanna go home."
translation.ko: 데이비드가 엄마에게 집에 가고 싶다고 했고

translation.en: She's like, "I can't leave. We'll get this done."
translation.ko: 엄마는 안 된다면서 다 끝내고 갈 거라고 했더니

translation.en: "As soon as we can, we'll go home." He's like, "I wanna go home now."
translation.ko: 엄마는 안 된다면서 다 끝내고 갈 거라고 했더니 지금 가야겠대요

translation.en: I just wanted to get out of the house,
off the property, away from it as far as I could.
And I… I didn't tell anybody the reason why.
We got back home, had dinner, everything was fine.
translation.ko: 집에 돌아와서 저녁을 먹었고 전부 괜찮았어요

translation.en: My mom was an excellent cook.
translation.ko: "글래츨 가족 홈 비디오" 엄마가 요리를 잘하셨어요

translation.en: She was Hungarian and Italian,
so she knew how to cook.
But David was having a bad day. Something was bothering him.
translation.ko: 근데 데이비드는 뭔가 안 좋은 일이 있는 듯했어요

translation.en: And I said, "What's wrong with you?"
[David] I remember sitting at the table.
Started explaining what had happened that morning.
translation.ko: 그날 아침에 있었던 일을 설명하기 시작했죠

translation.en: I was in the bedroom on my own.
But I could feel something.
And then I was pushed backwards onto the bed.
translation.ko: 뭔가에 밀려서 등 쪽으로 침대에 쓰러졌죠

translation.en: [David] I seen this image.
It looked like the devil from a Halloween costume.
His eyes were black, solid black, just like a chunk of coal,
and it scared me.
David said, "Then this entity spoke."
translation.ko: 데이비드 말이 그 형체가 말을 했대요

translation.en: [Debbie] I said to David, "What is this figure telling you?"
"He keeps telling me beware."
I said, "Beware of what?"
And he kept telling me, "He wants my soul."
translation.ko: 그냥 자꾸 자기 영혼을 원한다고만 말하더라고요

translation.en: And he said, "He's gonna come for me. That's what he keeps telling me."
"I-- You gotta help me."
I said, "Dave, did you touch anything in the medicine cabinet?"
translation.ko: 저는 약통에 든 약을 건드렸느냐고 물었더니

translation.en: He goes, "No, this is for real."
We didn't believe him at first.
translation.ko: 우린 처음에 그 말을 안 믿었어요

translation.en: [Alan] My mom's reaction was,
"It was late at night. Maybe he was dreaming."
[Arne] Judy said, "Okay, enough of this."
"It's time to go to bed, get some rest, and we'll revisit this in the morning."
translation.ko: 잘 시간이니 가서 쉬고 내일 아침에 다시 얘기하자고요

translation.en: [David] Later that night, I got sort of a weird feeling.
I just had this image.
There was something coming.
I started to get scared
'cause I could see it coming closer towards the house.
You can feel something watching you.
I thought I saw a figure.
[David] When I look again…
there's nothing there.
I stayed up in the dark with my eyes open most of the night.
[Arne] Judy was worried about David,
so she called Father Dennis up to let him know what was happening.
She asked him if he could come bless the house.
[Judy] Bless you too, Father.
My mom was religious.
She made us go through Communion and Confirmation as Catholics.
translation.ko: 우리에게 가톨릭교인으로서 첫영성체와 견진 성사를 받게 하셨죠

translation.en: We did believe in God and the devil.
When Father Dennis had come to the house, he brought some holy oil, some holy water,
and some incense…
[Father Dennis] In the name of the Father…
[David] …that he used to bless the entire house, every room, upstairs and downstairs.
We thought it was over and done with.
[Father Dennis] I pray against any evil that…
translation.ko: 이 집에 들어오려는 어떠한 악도 막아주시고…

translation.en: But this was just the beginning.
[Debbie gasps] Oh my God!
[Alan] It was three o'clock in the morning.
All of a sudden, David was screaming at the top of his lungs,
"He's coming for me. He's coming for me. He's gonna punish me."
translation.ko: '그자가 날 잡으러 와요 날 벌할 거예요'

translation.en: The house rumbled…
…like someone had drove a truck into it.
It sounded like a UFO was landing on top of the house.
Whatever it was, it wanted you to know it was there.
translation.ko: 그게 뭐였든 간에 존재감을 확실히 보였죠

translation.en: Lights began to flash on and off.
You'd hear the glass falling, breaking.
David was frantic, and he was screaming, "He's here. He's here. He's over the house."
translation.ko: 데이비드는 미친 듯이 소리 지르며 그가 집에 왔다고 했어요

translation.en: David's like, "Don't open the door. It's evil."
The banging went on for 30, maybe 40 seconds…
…and then everything went quiet.
-[glass shatters] -[Debbie] Oh my God.
I was petrified.
Okay, we have a ghost problem,
um, and we didn't know what to do with it.
We knew we had to find some help.
[Alan] At that time, our next-door neighbor,
she was into tarot card reading and stuff like that.
translation.ko: 타로 읽기 같은 데 관심이 있었어요

translation.en: And she said, "You know, my mother-in-law said
she had gone, a couple of years ago, to see a psychic investigator."
translation.ko: 두어 해 전에 심령 조사관을 만나러 간 적이 있다면서

translation.en: "Maybe they can help."
Debbie is like, "I'll take help from anyone."
We weren't gonna let no entity,
no… no ghost or anybody run us out of that house.
translation.ko: 우리를 그 집에서 쫓아낼 수는 없다고 생각했어요

translation.en: That was our house,
and we were gonna make sure that whatever was there,
we were gonna get it out one way or the other.
Our special guests tonight, who in their 32 years as ghost hunters,
translation.ko: 오늘 특별 손님은 32년간 귀신 사냥꾼으로 일하면서

translation.en: have investigated over 3,000 cases of haunted houses and demonic possession
translation.ko: 3,000건이 넘는 귀신 들린 집과 악귀에 씌었던 사례를 조사했고

translation.en: and have been involved in numerous exorcisms around the world.
translation.ko: 전 세계에서 수많은 구마식에 참여하신 분들입니다

translation.en: Listen closely and make up your own mind as we present to you,
translation.ko: 신사 숙녀 여러분 잘 듣고 결정하시기 바랍니다

translation.en: ladies and gentlemen, the ghost hunters Ed and Lorraine Warren.
[man] I was so proud of my grandparents when I was growing up.
[man] I would see them in the newspaper or on television,
and it was just so cool.
But on the other hand,
I was also the weird kid because I had these creepy grandparents.
translation.ko: 이상한 아이 취급을 받았죠 "크리스 매키널 워런 부부의 손자" 조부모님이 이상했으니까요

translation.en: [Ed] The truth of the matter is, I did not wake up one day and say,
"I want to be a demonologist."
I was born a demonologist.
As a boy, I would ask the nuns and the priest, uh,
translation.ko: 어릴 땐 수녀님과 신부님께 물어보곤 했어요

translation.en: "What is this about ghosts, the supernatural? Is it for real?"
"Are there really devils?"
And, of course, you know, Catholicism teaches us that these things are real.
translation.ko: 물론 가톨릭교에서는 이런 게 실재한다고 가르쳐요

translation.en: My grandmother had a different, uh, experience.
-I hear laughter and I don't-- -[Ed] Laughter?
-I don't quite understand. I can hear it-- -Is it male or a female laughter?
I mean, I can't understand why all of you don't hear it.
translation.ko: 이해가 안 가요, 왜들 못 들어요?

translation.en: I hear it so… It-- It's so loud in here.
He said, "Well, if you wanna hunt tigers, you got to go to where tigers are."
translation.ko: 할아버지는 호랑이를 잡으려면 호랑이 굴에 가야 한다고 하셨어요

translation.en: -Go to the light, Charissa. -[shrieking]
I'm here to help you.
But they didn't reach any fame until…
A young man murdered, in cold blood,
his father, mother, four brothers and sisters,
because voices told him to do it.
With that grueling beginning comes a bestseller and a motion picture,
translation.ko: 그렇게 험난한 시작으로 베스트셀러 책과 영화가 나왔죠

translation.en: The Amityville Horror.
Lorraine and I have been in hundreds and hundreds of haunted houses,
translation.ko: 러레인과 저는 귀신 들린 집 수백 곳에 가 봤어요

translation.en: and we've interviewed numerous people all over the world.
And on a scale of one to ten, I would have to say that Amityville was a ten.
The Amityville Horror was the one that went international.
That's the one where my grandparents became world-famous.
-And, well, it's number two. -[audience applauding]
It's funny how something so horrifying can end up becoming a blessing.
translation.ko: 그렇게 끔찍한 일이 축복이 될 수 있다니 놀랍죠

translation.en: Thank you, Mr. Warren.
And it… it really did help a lot of families afterward.
translation.ko: 그 후 많은 가족에게 도움이 되긴 했고요

translation.en: We are receiving a lot of letters
from people who are… are writing in about problems.
What's the address?
Post office box-- Send it to the Warrens, Ed and Lorraine Warren,
translation.ko: 사서함인데 워런 씨 부부 에드와 러레인 워런 앞이에요

translation.en: Post Office Box 41, Monroe, Connecticut 06468.
[Alan] Debbie called up the Warrens.
Ed answered.
Debbie said who she was and, "Can you help us?"
translation.ko: 누나가 자기를 소개한 후 도와달라고 했어요

translation.en: Ed said, "Has David been seen by a doctor at this point?"
translation.ko: 데이비드가 병원 진찰을 받았는지 에드가 묻더군요

translation.en: We said, "No."
So Ed's like, "Do you mind if I bring a doctor with me?"
[Alan] They showed up in a Chevy Chevette.
Ed Warren was a really nice man.
He was reassuring, confident.
He definitely made us feel safer.
Lorraine was so gentle and precise in her words.
translation.ko: 러레인은 아주 온화하고 말을 정확하게 했어요

translation.en: Judy said, "Oh my God,
I'm so glad you're here and so glad to meet you."
[Alan] The doctor took David aside, took his blood pressure, stuff like that.
translation.ko: 의사가 데이비드를 데려가서 혈압을 재는 등 이것저것 했어요

translation.en: He was tested psychologically, proven to be completely normal.
Dr. Tony never said that I was off my rocker or anything like that.
translation.ko: 토니 선생님은 제가 정신 나가거나 그런 건 아니라고 하셨어요

translation.en: He said I was a… a normal kid.
[Alan] Ed and Lorraine were very cautious talking to us.
They wanted us to answer some questions, find out what's going on.
[Ed] Okay.
[Ed on tape] David, give me your full name.
-[David] David Michael Glatzel. -[Ed] Okay, how old are you, David?
translation.ko: - 데이비드 마이클 글래츨요 - 몇 살이지, 데이비드?

translation.en: -[young David] Twelve. -[Ed] Twelve years old.
What do you think about all these things, David?
-You'd like it to end, right? -[young David] Hmm? -You'd like it to end? -Mm-hmm.
-You don't want it to go on, do you? -No.
[Ed] No. Okay.
There was one violent scene here that Lorraine told me about.
translation.ko: 러레인이 말하기로는 격한 상황이 한 번 있었다고?

translation.en: -[Judy] It was more than one. -[Ed] More than one?
translation.ko: - 한 번이 아니었어요 - 한 번이 아니에요?

translation.en: [Judy] Oh my God, it was all night!
[Ed] Okay, so in other words, it was a very hectic night.
[Judy] Oh yeah, but see, we can't tolerate no more, really.
translation.ko: 네, 맞아요 근데 더는 못 참겠어요

translation.en: We're not lying to you 'cause, you know, we need the help we can get.
Believe me, we wanna get rid of this thing.
My mom was so hopeful that this would be a cure-all.
translation.ko: 엄마는 이게 만병통치약일 거라며 기대가 크셨어요

translation.en: She wanted her family back,
and she wanted to go back to the life we had before this.
[Ed] These people are telling us these horrible stories,
translation.ko: 다들 정말 끔찍한 이야기를 우리에게 해 주지만

translation.en: but we have to, ourselves, experience this before we accept it.
translation.ko: 그걸 받아들이기 전에 우리가 직접 경험해야 해요

translation.en: -[host] All right. -We have to see it. We have to feel it.
We have to know it's there before we say, "Yes, this home is haunted."
translation.ko: 귀신 들린 집이라고 말하기 전에 진짜인지 알아야 해요

translation.en: [Judy] He told David he wants his soul today.
[Ed] What'd he tell you about your soul?
Says he just wants my soul. That was it.
[Ed] Is he here now?
Ed's like, "Let's see it show itself."
translation.ko: 그게 나타나는지 한번 보자고 에드가 그러더군요

translation.en: "It's got so much power, it needs to prove that it's here."
translation.ko: 강력한 힘을 가진 존재니 여기 있다는 걸 증명할 거라면서요

translation.en: I have to provoke what is there through religious provocation.
translation.ko: 종교적인 도발을 통해 거기 있는 존재를 불러와야 해요

translation.en: Now being a Christian, I would use the name of Jesus Christ.
translation.ko: 가톨릭교인인 저는 예수 그리스도의 이름을 쓰고

translation.en: I would use holy water. I would use the crucifix.
Now, this may seem dramatic,
but this is the method that the exorcist and the demonologist uses.
I provoke until I can witness physical manifestations occurring.
[Alan] Ed said, "If you have the power,
I need you to knock on the table three times."
[Arne] All of a sudden…
-[loud banging and rumbling] -Bang! Bang! Bang!
Sounded like someone took a sledgehammer, trying to break through the kitchen floor.
translation.ko: 누가 큰 망치로 주방 바닥을 뚫으려 하는 듯했어요

translation.en: The entire kitchen started to shake.
The lights were flickering. Everybody felt it.
[Arne] Ed looked at David and he said, "Does this frighten you?"
David goes, "I'm afraid because he wants to hurt me."
translation.ko: 데이비드는 그자가 자기를 해치려 해서 두렵다고 했어요

translation.en: "Because I'm talking to you and you're here,
we're all gonna be punished for this."
At that point, Lorraine was walking around.
translation.ko: 그때 러레인이 집 안을 돌아다니기 시작했어요

translation.en: Going into a home, I'm there to discern, through vibrations,
translation.ko: 저는 집에 들어가서 진동을 통해 상황을 파악해요

translation.en: walking throughout every room of the house.
Because there has to be a law of attraction.
The spirit has to be attracted to one member of that particular household.
translation.ko: 그 집 안의 한 사람에게 혼령이 끌릴 수밖에 없어요

translation.en: [Alan] She leaned over to him and whispered,
"There's a large dark mass standing next to that little boy."
translation.ko: '저 아이 옆에 크고 어두운 형체가 있어'

translation.en: "It's evil."
That felt strange to us. We couldn't see nothing.
translation.ko: 우리가 보기엔 이상했죠 아무것도 안 보였거든요

translation.en: Ed and Lorraine spoke to my parents.
"This is not a ghost. This is a demonic entity."
[David] It really scared me.
The whole family was scared 'cause we had no idea what was going on.
translation.ko: 온 가족이 겁에 질렸죠 무슨 일인지 전혀 몰랐으니까요

translation.en: You know, my grandfather had this idea that hauntings progressed in five steps.
translation.ko: 할아버지는 귀신에 들릴 때 다섯 단계를 거친다고 하셨어요

translation.en: It starts with permission.
Somebody does something
that allows the paranormal to take a foothold.
Maybe it's an Ouija board or a séance or whatever.
Then you have infestation.
That's where the spirits are in the home, but external to you completely.
translation.ko: 이때는 혼령이 집에는 있지만 사람 몸 바깥에 있죠

translation.en: Just a ghost or, you know, a loved one comes to visit and wants to let you know they're there.
translation.ko: 유령이거나 사랑하는 사람이 와서 존재감을 알리는 거예요

translation.en: That's… That's normal.
Then you have oppression.
That's when an entity is starting to take over your free will.
translation.ko: 이 단계에서 어떤 존재가 사람의 의지를 지배하기 시작하죠

translation.en: But you're exhibiting much darker impulses, much more negative behaviors.
translation.ko: 더 어두운 충동이 생기고 부정적인 행동을 보여요

translation.en: In incredibly rare circumstances, it moves on to complete possession.
translation.ko: 아주 드문 경우지만 그러다 완전히 빙의가 돼요

translation.en: That's where you're no longer there. You're not in control.
translation.ko: 그때는 자기 자신은 없어요 통제할 수 없는 상태죠

translation.en: Your body has been taken over completely by something else.
translation.ko: 다른 무언가가 완전히 몸을 지배한 상태예요

translation.en: [Alan] Ed felt strong enough from that first meeting
that David was already in oppression stage.
[Arne] Ed explained to us
that the demon would be causing David to act totally different.
translation.ko: 에드는 악마 때문에 데이비드가 완전히 다르게 행동할 거라고 했어요

translation.en: Controlling his thoughts, sending messages through him.
translation.ko: 생각을 통제하고 걔를 통해 메시지를 전달한대요

translation.en: He would become more volatile.
[Alan] Ed Warren had seen this many times before.
translation.ko: 에드 워런은 전에도 이런 걸 많이 봤었어요

translation.en: He said, "You're gonna have to contact the church."
My mom said, "We did that. We tried."
And Ed spoke up and said, "No, I will help you do that."
"You guys need to start documenting this."
And collect as much evidence as they can, to present it to the archbishop.
translation.ko: 대주교님께 제출할 증거를 최대한 많이 모으라더군요

translation.en: And the archbishop of Bridgeport would make the decision
as far as what we were dealing with.
[Arne] I thought, "This stuff isn't real. It doesn't happen."
translation.ko: 이런 일이 실제로 일어나다니 믿을 수 없었어요

translation.en: "It's only… in cartoons and movies."
Ed and Lorraine warned us how serious this really is.
translation.ko: 이 상황이 얼마나 심각한지 에드와 러레인이 경고했어요

translation.en: "Don't take it lightly."
"Protect yourself,
because you never know when it can happen."
[Alan] My mom took our audio tape cassette recorder.
My sister bought a Polaroid camera, you know, that takes instant photos.
translation.ko: 누나는 즉석 사진을 찍는 폴라로이드 카메라를 사 왔죠

translation.en: From that moment forward, we started keeping records of everything.
We were on summer vacation from school.
[host on TV] Good evening, ladies and gentlemen…
[Alan] No one was sleeping.
[host] …two candidates for the Republican nomination
for the presidency of the United States.
Former Governor Ronald Reagan of California. Former ambassador…
translation.ko: 캘리포니아의 로널드 레이건 전 주지사님과 전직 대사이신…

translation.en: [Alan] We were taking turns keeping an eye on David.
[Ronald Reagan] Whether we like it or not,
it is our responsibility to preserve world peace
translation.ko: 세계 평화를 수호하는 건 우리 책임입니다

translation.en: because no one else can do it.
[in distorted voice] We cannot continue…
But then David started acting really weird.
[Judy] David!
Oh my God.
You will die! You!
[Judy] Who are you and what are you?
-[possessed David] None of your business. -[Judy] David.
[Judy] Mommy's here. Mommy's here. Come on, get up.
Come on, let's go. Get out of it. Get out of my son. Get out of my son.
translation.ko: 어서 나와, 나오라고 내 아들한테서 나와

translation.en: [possessed David snarling] No! No! [Judy] I'm your mother.
You will die!
Don't do that! [laughs evilly]
[Judy] David, just get up! My God! Get up--
[Debbie] Call the priest, Ma.
-Have him come to the house right now. -[Judy] Get out of my son!
translation.ko: - 당장 집으로 오라고 해요 - 내 아들한테서 나가!

translation.en: -[possessed David] No! -[young Arne] Leave this boy alone.
translation.ko: - 안 돼! - 우리 아들 건드리지 마

translation.en: [Debbie] Here. Here.
[young Arne] I'm trying. I got your arms again.
translation.ko: - 하고 있어요, 팔 다시 잡았어요 - 이 거지 같은 게

translation.en: -[possessed David] You fucking cocksucker. -[young Arne] Start saying prayers.
translation.ko: - 하고 있어요, 팔 다시 잡았어요 - 이 거지 같은 게 기도하자

translation.en: [all] Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name.
translation.ko: 하늘에 계신 우리 아버지 아버지의 이름이 거룩히 빛나시며

translation.en: Thy kingdom come,
thy will be done, on earth as it is in heaven.
translation.ko: 아버지의 뜻이 하늘에서와 같이 땅에서도 이루어지소서

translation.en: Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses,
translation.ko: 오늘 저희에게 일용할 양식을 주시고 저희에게 잘못한 이를 저희가 용서하오니

translation.en: as we forgive those who trespass against us…
translation.ko: 저희에게 잘못한 이를 저희가 용서하오니 저희 죄를 용서하시고…

translation.en: [Alan] It was terrifying…
[young Arne] Leave this boy.
…because all of a sudden, he'll start screaming and fighting,
translation.ko: 갑자기 소리 지르고 발버둥 치기 시작하는데

translation.en: and there's no one there.
[Alan] At one point, we were able to capture on film
his hands in midair holding something,
translation.ko: 손을 허공에 들고는 뭔가를 잡고 있었어요

translation.en: choking him, and he was squeezing with all his might to get these hands
translation.ko: 목이 막힌 듯했고 목 주변에 있는 손을

translation.en: from around his throat off of his throat.
translation.ko: 온 힘을 다해서 떼려고 하고 있었어요

translation.en: [young Arne] Leave this boy. Leave this boy.
We had the chills up and down our spine.
[Arne] It was very frightening, and we didn't really know how to handle it.
[David] I remember being choked,
but I don't remember anything else when I blacked out
or if I even blacked out or what happened.
Nobody could ever answer that.
It was mentally draining for everyone,
but it just kept getting progressively worse.
He was physically violent with everyone.
[Alan] He's tried choking my mother, my sister.
It would last for a few minutes or a few hours.
[Alan] We would take turns sleeping in shifts.
[Alan] We didn't want to be isolated.
We know that if we were alone, our chances of an attack were exponential.
The whole family was getting physically attacked.
We were saying prayers constantly.
We figured if we said the prayers louder and louder, it would go away.
translation.ko: 기도를 더 크게 하면 사라질 거라고 생각했죠

translation.en: [Alan] The most difficult part for my mom was the fact
that my dad wasn't standing behind her on this.
translation.ko: 아빠가 이 일을 지지해 주지 않았다는 점이었어요

translation.en: She felt alone.
My father, at this point,
thought David was just having a mental health issue,
thought we were feeding into it.
So he kind of just locked himself away.
He was working two jobs and come home and sleep.
translation.ko: 겹벌이를 하시며 집에 와서 잠만 잤어요

translation.en: Things changed. We went from having a normal family dinner
translation.ko: 상황이 변했어요 가족 저녁을 먹던 평범한 생활에서 일만 하고 집에 안 오시게 됐죠

translation.en: to him working constantly, not being home.
translation.ko: 가족 저녁을 먹던 평범한 생활에서 일만 하고 집에 안 오시게 됐죠

translation.en: It took my dad a while before he realized what was going on.
translation.ko: 아빠가 상황을 이해하기까지 시간이 좀 걸렸어요

translation.en: And by then, you know, it was too late.
My mom called up the Warrens and told them what was going on.
translation.ko: 엄마가 워런 씨 부부에게 전화해서 상황을 설명했어요

translation.en: [Judy] I'm your mother.
-[Judy speaking indistinctly] -[possessed David] Don't do that!
-[Judy] He didn't know who was doing it. -[Ed] Does he blink his eyes?
[Judy] No, nothing. They absolutely just stay perfectly still.
translation.ko: 아뇨, 아무 반응 없었어요 얼어붙은 듯 가만히 있었어요

translation.en: [Ed] If he was conscious, his eyes would blink, right?
[Judy] You mean he was unconscious when he did this, when this happened?
translation.ko: 이렇게 됐을 때 애가 의식이 없었단 말씀이에요?

translation.en: Well, I would think so, yeah. Okay.
Ed and Lorraine told us that David was under possession.
translation.ko: 에드와 러레인은 데이비드가 악귀에 씌었다고 했어요

translation.en: [Chris] After possession,
the ultimate goal is the destruction of the family and, finally, death.
translation.ko: 최종 목표는 가족의 파괴 그리고 결국 죽음이에요

translation.en: You're being killed, or… where somebody else is murdered,
it does happen.
[Judy] He went behind Alan, he pulled this out, and he goes, "I hate everybody."
translation.ko: 앨런 뒤에 가서 이걸 꺼내고는 전부 다 싫다고 했어요

translation.en: "And if anybody goes near me, I'll kill you. Anybody."
My mom panicked right then and there.
She thought something was gonna happen where her son would kill himself
or commit murder.
She was like, "We need to stop this now."
Ed Warren said, "You're going to definitely need an exorcism."
translation.ko: 에드 워런은 구마식을 꼭 해야 한다고 했어요

translation.en: That was probably the most frightening thing.
[Ed on tape] We are like a supernatural police department.
We have to bring the culprits to the church.
We have to bring the culprits to the exorcist.
This is why I say,
when the demonic and evil spirits fight dirty,
you have to do the very same thing.
[Alan] The church don't give out exorcisms like candy.
I did not realize the amount of paperwork you have to go through
translation.ko: 구마식을 받기 위해 내야 하는 서류가 그리 많은지

translation.en: to get an exorcism.
It is a big deal.
[man] The request process for an exorcism in the Roman Catholic Church
translation.ko: 로마 가톨릭교회에서 구마식 신청 과정이 쉽지는 않아요

translation.en: is not necessarily easy,
translation.ko: 로마 가톨릭교회에서 구마식 신청 과정이 쉽지는 않아요 "막시모스 신부 러시아 정교회 성직자"

translation.en: especially back when Ed and Lorraine were in their prime.
translation.ko: 특히 에드와 러레인이 전성기를 누리던 시기에는요

translation.en: In my experience, there's a lot of clergy that do not want to deal with this stuff.
translation.ko: 제 경험상 이런 일을 꺼리는 성직자가 많아요

translation.en: They don't want to deal with the infernal forces…
…and they're afraid to step foot in those homes.
translation.ko: 그런 집에 발을 들여놓는 걸 무서워해요

translation.en: So I can see where people turn to people like the Warrens
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부 같은 사람들에게 왜 다들 기대는지 이해해요

translation.en: because their own clergy have rejected them.
But it's a duty as a clergyman.
translation.ko: 하지만 그건 성직자로서 해야 할 일이에요

translation.en: You're called to do this, and you're called to help those people.
translation.ko: 이 일을 해서 그 사람들을 돕는 게 성직자의 소명이죠

translation.en: Growing up in the Roman Catholic Church,
angels, devils,
these things are, uh, entrenched in the belief system.
But I always sort of questioned the reality of these spiritual forces.
translation.ko: 하지만 전 영적인 힘의 실체에 늘 의문이 들었어요

translation.en: So I was very open
and looking for the evidence to see if this truly existed or not.
Now, people can poo-poo the whole idea of ghosts
translation.ko: 사람들은 귀신이나 귀신 들린 집, 악마 등

translation.en: and haunted houses and devils all they want,
translation.ko: 이런 개념 자체를 완전히 무시하기도 하지만

translation.en: but the devil does exist.
Many devils exist,
and a skeptical public is the best protection that the devil has.
translation.ko: 회의적인 대중이야말로 악마에게는 최고의 보호 장비예요

translation.en: -[priest] In the name of Jesus… -[woman screaming]
…get out!
[Father Maximos] Working with the Warrens was certainly intriguing, somewhat exciting.
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부와 일하는 건 분명 흥미진진했어요

translation.en: I saw how real this is and how dangerous it could be.
translation.ko: 이게 진짜라는 것과 위험할 수도 있다는 걸 알게 됐죠

translation.en: [Alan] The church realized by all the evidence we had gathered
translation.ko: 가톨릭교회 측에서 우리가 모은 증거를 보고는

translation.en: that, yeah, this is a real deal, and they need help.
A cardinal from the Catholic Church showed up.
They dress completely in red, and he also drove a red Porsche.
translation.ko: 전부 빨간색으로 입고 빨간 포르쉐를 몰고 왔어요

translation.en: Oh, it's good to be in the church.
He met with the family.
They decided we have something here that needs to be fixed.
translation.ko: 뭔가 해결해야 할 일이 있다고 결론을 내렸죠

translation.en: The Catholic Church gave us authorization to perform a minor exorcism.
translation.ko: 가톨릭교회 측에서 작은 구마식을 시행해도 좋다고 허락했어요

translation.en: They invited my family to St. Joseph's Church in Brookfield.
translation.ko: 브룩필드의 세인트 조지프 성당에 가족들을 초대하더군요

translation.en: I didn't think anything bad could happen, 'cause I'm in the house of God.
translation.ko: 주님의 집에서 하니까 나쁜 일이 생기진 않을 것 같았죠

translation.en: The priest, Father Virgulak, warned us. He said, "These exorcisms,
translation.ko: 버줄락 신부님께서 경고하시길 이런 구마식은 너무 강렬해서

translation.en: they could be so intense that death can happen."
translation.ko: 이런 구마식은 너무 강렬해서 사망할 수도 있대요

translation.en: And that was very frightening.
But we didn't have a choice.
[Father Virgulak] Let us pray.
In the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
It starts out similar to a… a mass.
[all] Our Father, who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name…
translation.ko: 하늘에 계신 우리 아버지 아버지의 이름이 거룩히 빛나시며…

translation.en: [David] I just remember being there, in the church,
and that they said the prayers. That's all I remember.
translation.ko: 기도문을 외웠는데 제 기억은 그게 다예요

translation.en: Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses…
translation.ko: 오늘 저희에게 일용할 양식을 주시고 저희에게 잘못한 이를…

translation.en: All of a sudden, the whole room dropped to ice-cold.
We immediately realized something was wrong.
translation.ko: 그 순간 다들 뭔가 잘못됐다는 걸 알았죠

translation.en: [all] Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us…
translation.ko: 천주의 성모 마리아님 이제와 우리 죽을 때…

translation.en: Within minutes, David's behavior started to change.
translation.ko: 얼마 지나지 않아 데이비드가 달라지기 시작했어요

translation.en: He started growling, hissing, calling the priest all kinds of names.
translation.ko: 으르렁거리고 쉭쉭거리면서 신부님께 온갖 욕을 다 했어요

translation.en: [possessed David] Fat dick, pork chop.
You'll die.
David shook and shuddered.
His features changed.
You're watching his body jerk from side to side.
[in raspy voice] Fuck you and your shit!
Then he would break free and… and try to attack Father Virgulak,
translation.ko: 잡은 손을 뿌리치고 버줄락 신부님을 공격하려고 해서

translation.en: so we had to pin him down.
translation.ko: 꼼짝 못 하게 꽉 잡아야 했죠

translation.en: I remember holding on to his leg. [Alan] Ed Warren holding onto the other one.
translation.ko: 제가 한쪽 다리를 잡았고 에드 워런이 반대쪽을 잡았어요

translation.en: -[screaming continues] -[Father Virgulak] It is now a time with--
He would move his body in positions that you shouldn't be able to bend.
translation.ko: 사람이라면 구부릴 수 없는 자세로 몸을 움직였어요

translation.en: As I would hold him down, I would tell him how Jesus loves him.
translation.ko: 애를 붙잡고 있으면서 예수님이 많이 사랑한다고 말했죠

translation.en: [young Arne] You are weak. Jesus is a lot stronger than you are.
translation.ko: 넌 약해, 예수님은 너보다 훨씬 강해

translation.en: You… You are so weak.
God, this is God's child. You can't hurt God's child.
translation.ko: 이 아이는 주님의 자녀다 주님의 자녀를 해치진 못한다

translation.en: [possessed David] Jesus is gonna die in hell.
-[Judy] Mommy loves you. -[possessed David growling]
It knew that this was the final blowdown.
translation.ko: 마지막 싸움인 걸 그 존재도 알았어요

translation.en: [young Arne] He needs a crucifix. You can give it to me. It's been blessed.
translation.ko: 십자가가 필요해 나한테 줘, 축성받은 거야

translation.en: Arne had taken the crucifix and placed it on his forehead.
-[young Arne] He's on your head. -[possessed David screaming]
[Alan] You could see it sizzle.
[Father Virgulak] In the name of our Lord Jesus Christ…
At one point, his tongue swelled up so much
translation.ko: 어느 순간엔 혀가 너무 뒤로 말려서

translation.en: that he couldn't breathe.
He turned blue.
Everybody's screaming. We gotta stop.
translation.ko: 다들 소리를 질렀고 당장 막아야 했어요

translation.en: [Arne] You feel helpless, empty.
I yelled at this thing to the top of my lungs.
I said, "Leave this little kid alone. Take me on."
translation.ko: '이 애는 내버려 둬! 차라리 나한테 와'

translation.en: "I'm here. Take me on."
I felt this coldness come over me.
Ice-cold.
Lorraine said, "Oh my God. What did you do?"
translation.ko: 러레인이 그러더군요 '맙소사, 무슨 짓을 한 거야?'

translation.en: Ed goes, "Uh, you-- you can't do this."
You don't challenge any kind of demonic entity, ever.
translation.ko: 어떠한 악마적 존재도 도발해선 안 돼요

translation.en: We didn't know any better. He thought he was just trying to help David.
translation.ko: 우리도 그건 몰랐어요 데이비드를 도우려고 그런 거죠

translation.en: I remember my grandfather saying to him, "You shouldn't say that."
translation.ko: 할아버지께서 말씀하셨어요 '그런 말은 하면 안 돼'

translation.en: "That just opens the door for you to be attacked."
And he was right.
[Alan] But we felt that it was over.
translation.ko: 하지만 우린 다 끝난 줄 알았어요

translation.en: David was exorcised.
[David] I remember I was happy.
I spent a lot of time just playing outside,
trying to be a good kid, be the good boy of the family.
translation.ko: 착한 아이가 되려 했고 가족들에게도 잘하려고 했어요

translation.en: [David] My mom, she baked,
feed us, keep us happy.
[Alan] We thought we were going to have a new start.
And it didn't work out that way.
I was aware that there were strange things,
translation.ko: 글래츨 씨네 집에서 "글렌 쿠퍼 코네티컷주 형사" 뭔가 이상한 악귀 관련 일이 생긴다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: demonic things, allegedly happening at the Glatzel house.
translation.ko: 뭔가 이상한 악귀 관련 일이 생긴다는 걸 알았어요

translation.en: Some of the police officers had gotten noise complaints there or something.
translation.ko: 일부 경찰관에게 소음 신고가 접수되기도 했죠

translation.en: I was a detective on duty,
and Ed and Lorraine Warren came to the old police department
translation.ko: 에드와 러레인 워런이 그레이스 브리지 로드에 있는 오래된 경찰서에 왔더군요

translation.en: on Grays Bridge Road.
translation.ko: 그레이스 브리지 로드에 있는 오래된 경찰서에 왔더군요

translation.en: Ed Warren introduced himself as a demonologist,
and Lorraine Warren introduced herself as a psychic.
Lorraine was upset.
She went on to tell me that during one of the actual exorcisms,
Arne Cheyenne Johnson challenged the devil
translation.ko: 아니 샤이엔 존슨이 데이비드 글래츨의 몸에서 나와

translation.en: to leave David Glatzel and take him on.
Lorraine was very upset about that.
translation.ko: 러레인은 그 점에서 화가 나 있었죠

translation.en: She says, "He should not have done that. You cannot do that."
"He does not know what he's up against."
translation.ko: 자기 상대가 누군지 모르고 한 짓이라면서요

translation.en: And she said, "I see serious injury or death with a knife."
translation.ko: 칼을 사용해 심각하게 다치거나 죽는 게 보인다고 했어요

translation.en: She wanted to put us on notice that a crime could occur.
translation.ko: 범죄가 일어날 수도 있다고 경고하려 했어요

translation.en: That she actually-- I want to make it clear.
She said, "I see this happening as a psychic."
translation.ko: 자기가 실제로… 분명히 이렇게 말했어요 심령술사로서 이런 일이 생길 게 보인대요

translation.en: She was matter-of-fact. She didn't look bizarre.
She didn't act bizarre.
I thought she was relating what she really believed,
translation.ko: 자기가 그렇다고 믿는 걸 말하는 것 같았어요

translation.en: and to her, it was real.
And lo and behold, apparently, it was real.
My sister took a job at the kennels in Brookfield.
translation.ko: 데비가 브룩필드에 있는 반려견 사육소에 취직했어요

translation.en: She wanted to start a life with Arne.
[Debbie] I'm a dog groomer.
My boss was Alan Bono, who became a friend of Arne's and mine.
translation.ko: 제 상사였던 앨런 보노는 아니와 제 친구가 됐어요 "앨런 보노 데비의 상사"

translation.en: Arne and I ended up getting an apartment,
and the apartment came with the job and so on.
Oh, we were really excited about being… to be able to live together.
We were able to take a deep breath and let things calm down
translation.ko: 숨 좀 돌리면서 상황이 잠잠해지길 기다렸죠

translation.en: after all the trial and tribulation we'd just been through.
We felt a sense of relief. Like, "Oh, it's finally over."
"It's over. Now we can get some peace."
translation.ko: 다 끝났으니 이제 평화로울 수 있을 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Lorraine] Remember that when you challenge the demonic,
it doesn't act at that particular given time.
It waits until you are the most vulnerable,
then it strikes.
[Arne] I didn't feel that well when we got up that morning, Debbie and I.
translation.ko: 데비와 아침에 눈을 떴는데 몸이 별로 안 좋았어요

translation.en: I felt a little ill.
We traveled down to Bridgeport to pick up my sisters
'cause we had plans on that weekend to spend time with them.
We got together with Alan Bono at lunch, so we had a couple glasses of wine.
translation.ko: 앨런 보노와 점심을 같이했고 와인을 두어 잔 마셨어요

translation.en: But you could see that Alan was getting a little inebriated.
And I just said to Debbie, I looked at Debbie and I turned and I said,
"Deb, why don't we just leave? I think it's a good time to leave
translation.ko: '우리 지금 갈까?' '애들을 여기서 데리고 나가는 게 좋겠어'

translation.en: and take the girls out of this environment."
[inhales deeply] Nothing bad was happening, but he was just getting a little boisterous
translation.ko: 나쁜 일이 생긴 건 아니지만 좀 떠들썩해지길래

translation.en: and this and that, and I didn't want my sisters to be around that.
We started walking down the stairs,
and then I personally don't remember anything after that.
[David] I think it was maybe seven or eight o'clock at night.
And I remember the phone rang.
-Hello? -My sister was on the phone crying.
[David] Before she can say anything, I had a vision of a man…
translation.ko: 누나가 말하기도 전에 어떤 남자의 환영이 보였어요

translation.en: dead.
David, get Mom! Get Mom!
Next thing you know, within ten seconds, my mom's screaming. So I'm like, "Oh God."
translation.ko: 10초도 안 돼서 엄마가 소리를 질렀고 전 큰일 났구나 싶었어요

translation.en: [Alan] She told my dad, "Get in the car. We gotta go to the kennel."
translation.ko: 엄마가 아빠에게 차에 타라면서 사육소에 가야 한댔어요

translation.en: David told me that Alan Bono's dead.
"How? What? What are you talking about?"
David said, "Arne Cheyenne Johnson was possessed."
translation.ko: 데이비드는 아니 샤이엔 존슨이 악귀에 씌었대요

translation.en: "It's the beast. He killed him."
[Glenn] I got a call from dispatch. I was told that there was a serious stabbing.
translation.ko: 무전기로 연락을 받았어요 심각한 칼부림이 있었대요

translation.en: We're calling all hands on deck.
Deborah Glatzel told arriving police patrol units
translation.ko: 데버라 글래츨은 도착한 경찰 순찰 대원들에게

translation.en: that Arne and Alan had been drinking.
translation.ko: 아니와 앨런이 술을 마시고 있었다고 했어요

translation.en: In the apartment, there was an argument, and it developed into a physical fight.
Ended out on the front lawn of the kennel about 13, 15 feet from the front door.
translation.ko: 그 사육소 앞 잔디까지 갔고 앞문에서 4m 정도 떨어져 있었죠

translation.en: During this fight, Arne pulled out a knife that he had in a sheath,
translation.ko: 싸우다가 칼집에 넣어둔 칼을 아니가 꺼내서는

translation.en: and he repeatedly stabbed Alan Bono.
Alan Bono fell mortally wounded.
Debbie Glatzel, uh, was very distraught,
relayed that Arne took off to the woods,
and that she thought he was gonna head to the family home
translation.ko: 오크 그로브 로드에 있는 가족의 집에 간 것 같대요

translation.en: on, uh, Oak Grove Road, which is not very far away.
[David] I just had this image of Arne.
And I could see him heading towards my house in Brookfield.
translation.ko: 브룩필드에 있는 우리 집으로 향하는 게 보였죠

translation.en: And then I knew right away Arne was possessed by the devil.
translation.ko: 아니가 악귀에 씌었다는 걸 바로 알 수 있었어요

translation.en: [Alan] My brother panicked.
He's dragging the bureau, with me, over to the door.
translation.ko: 저와 같이 서랍장을 끌어서 문 앞에 댔어요

translation.en: We've locked the door and secured it with a bureau because he's like,
"He's coming to kill me."
[Alan] Never in my life was I afraid of Arne Cheyenne Johnson,
not at all.
But when David told me he was under demonic possession,
translation.ko: 하지만 데이비드가 아니가 악귀에 씌었다고 하니까

translation.en: I was scared shitless.
The ambulance driver, returning from taking Alan Bono to the hospital,
translation.ko: 앨런 보노를 병원에 이송하고 돌아오던 구급차 기사가

translation.en: he saw a suspect matching the description,
called the police department, and they took him into custody.
translation.ko: 경찰에 신고한 덕분에 경찰서에 잡아 왔어요

translation.en: If it wasn't for that ambulance driver, I or my brother David could be dead today.
translation.ko: 그 구급차 기사가 아니었다면 저나 데이비드가 죽었을 수도 있죠

translation.en: [Glenn] I was assigned to process Arne Cheyenne Johnson.
translation.ko: 제가 아니 샤이엔 존슨을 접수하는 일을 맡았어요

translation.en: I took his fingerprints. Uh, I gave him his rights per Miranda.
translation.ko: 지문을 채취했고 미란다 원칙을 설명해 줬어요

translation.en: He just looked like he was in trouble, been involved in a fight, disheveled.
translation.ko: "브룩필드 경찰서" 그냥 싸우다가 검거된 것 같았죠 머리는 헝클어졌고요

translation.en: Things weren't right.
I was totally exhausted. I couldn't even stand up. I was on this bench.
translation.ko: 너무 피곤해서 서 있지도 못했고 벤치에 앉아 있었죠

translation.en: And I asked him. I said, "Why am I here? What's going on? What's going on?"
translation.ko: 내가 왜 여기 있는지 무슨 상황인지 물었더니

translation.en: And he said, "Well, you just killed your friend."
I said, "I did not."
I… I totally did not believe that. I said, "You're totally wrong."
translation.ko: 전혀 안 믿었어요 단단히 오해한 거라고 했어요

translation.en: "Alan's fine. We left the house."
translation.ko: 앨런은 괜찮다고 그 집에서 같이 나왔다고 했죠

translation.en: He goes, "No, he's dead, and you killed him."
translation.ko: 그랬더니 아니라며 앨런은 죽었고 내가 죽였대요

translation.en: There was no crying. There was no "I'm sorry."
It's, "I just don't know what's going on."
He couldn't recall anything about the murder.
translation.ko: 살인 사건에 대해 아무런 기억도 없었어요

translation.en: I've never hurt anybody.
translation.ko: 전 누굴 해친 적이 한 번도 없어요

translation.en: Never.
I've never been arrested for anything.
So… And I said that to them. And I said,
translation.ko: 경찰에도 그렇게 말했죠 내가 그랬을 리 없다면서 엉뚱한 사람을 잡았다고 했어요

translation.en: "There's no way I did this. You got the wrong person."
translation.ko: 내가 그랬을 리 없다면서 엉뚱한 사람을 잡았다고 했어요

translation.en: In the case of David Glatzel, when Arne Johnson became possessed
translation.ko: 데이비드 글래츨의 사례에서 아니 존슨이 구마를 돕고 악귀를 도발한 결과

translation.en: as a result of his assisting and in challenging the demonic entity,
translation.ko: 아니 존슨이 구마를 돕고 악귀를 도발한 결과 악귀에 씌었다는 건

translation.en: this is a possibility.
I have seen in the literature. They call this "transmigration,"
and this is where a diabolical spirit might go from a possessed person
translation.ko: 악귀에 씌었던 사람에게서 구마식에 있었던 누군가로 악귀가 옮겨가는 거죠

translation.en: to someone who is maybe present during an exorcism.
translation.ko: 구마식에 있었던 누군가로 악귀가 옮겨가는 거죠

translation.en: A defense attorney in Connecticut will try to prove his client is not guilty of murder
translation.ko: 코네티컷주의 피고인 측 변호인은 의뢰인의 살인 무죄를 주장합니다

translation.en: because the 19-year-old defendant
allegedly said that he was possessed by the devil at the time of the killing.
translation.ko: 살해 당시 악귀에 씌었던 상태였다는 주장이죠

translation.en: [newscaster 1] Nineteen-year-old Arne Cheyenne Johnson, with no previous history of violence,
translation.ko: 폭력 전력이 없는 19세 아니 샤이엔 존슨은

translation.en: is charged with the knifing murder of his landlord, Alan Bono,
translation.ko: 집주인 앨런 보노를 칼로 살해한 혐의로 기소됐습니다

translation.en: and claims he was possessed by demons at the time and doesn't remember doing it.
translation.ko: 당시 악귀에 씌어서 살해한 기억이 없다고 주장합니다

translation.en: [newscaster 2] His lover, Deborah Glatzel, who was there when it happened
translation.ko: 사건 당시 함께 있었고 남동생이 악귀에 씌었던

translation.en: and whose 11-year-old brother was said to be possessed,
gave her account of what happened.
I did not see no stabbing take place. I was right in the middle of it.
translation.ko: 전 그 상황에 있었지만 찌르는 건 못 봤어요

translation.en: [reporter] What did you witness?
Um, just a lot of pushing and shoving.
[reporter] Then what?
And then, all hell broke loose.
[Arne] Debbie felt that it would be proven,
felt very positive that we were gonna be able to prove demonic possession.
After what we've all been through,
it should tell everyone that the devil is for real.
[newscaster 3] Johnson's attorney, Martin Minnella,
made no mention of demons in the courtroom.
Until we have the results of the pathologist's report,
our own pathologist's report, and the autopsy, we can't do anything.
translation.ko: 부검 결과가 나오기 전까지는 아무것도 못 합니다

translation.en: I was not a believer in the paranormal.
So before I really got too much involved, I said I wanted to do some research.
translation.ko: 너무 깊이 관여하기 전에 "마틴 미넬라 아니 존슨의 변호인" 조사를 하고 싶다고 말했죠

translation.en: Ed and Lorraine Warren told me,
"It wasn't Arne Johnson himself."
"It was the demon who took over Arne's body
and killed Alan Bono."
My partner thought they were crackpots
translation.ko: 제 파트너는 그 사람들이 미쳤다고 생각했고

translation.en: and said, "Listen, stay as far away from this case as you can."
translation.ko: 이 사건에 관여할 생각은 꿈에도 꾸지 말라고 했어요

translation.en: But I wanted to hear more.
[reporter] Outside, it looks like a quaint New England home.
translation.ko: 밖에서 보면 예스러운 뉴잉글랜드 집 같습니다

translation.en: Inside, it resembles a set from a Hollywood horror movie.
translation.ko: 하지만 집 안은 할리우드 호러 영화 세트장 같죠

translation.en: It's a museum documenting paranormal activity.
And Ed and Lorraine Warren say everything you see comes from real events.
translation.ko: 에드와 러레인 워런은 이곳의 모든 물건이 실제 사건에 나왔다고 하죠

translation.en: You're in a building right now which houses probably, uh…
the most dangerous items of a preternatural nature in the world.
Down in a room where they had all these artifacts,
translation.ko: 밑으로 내려가 보니 온갖 인공물이 있는 방이 있었어요

translation.en: including a doll, which they said, "Don't ever touch that doll."
translation.ko: 이렇게 적힌 인형도 있었죠 '인형을 절대 만지지 마시오'

translation.en: Doll's name was Annabelle, I believe.
They played me these tapes.
[Judy on tape] Stay there!
-[possessed David] No! -[Judy] Yes!
-Stay there! -[possessed David laughs evilly]
[Martin] The Warrens showed me all the evidence they had.
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부가 그분들이 모은 증거를 보여줬어요

translation.en: [Lorraine] Open your eyes, David.
And, to me, it was very credible and believable.
I believed in the story,
I believed in the defense,
and I also believed there probably wasn't another lawyer in the state
translation.ko: 이 주에서 이런 변호를 통해 아니를 대변할 변호인은

translation.en: that would represent him with this defense.
[newscaster] "The devil made me do it."
That's precisely what criminal lawyer Martin Minnella says he will try to prove
translation.ko: 피고인 측 변호인 마틴 미넬라는 의뢰인의 재판에서

translation.en: when his client comes to trial.
The nature of our defense is one that has been used in England.
translation.ko: 우리 변호 방식은 영국에서 사용된 적이 있어요

translation.en: It's never been used in the United States, the defense of demonic possession.
translation.ko: 미국에서는 사용된 적 없는 악귀 빙의에 대한 변호죠

translation.en: [Brian] An indictment against Arne Johnson, who lived upstairs here,
translation.ko: 이곳 2층에서 살았던 아니 존슨에 대한 기소는

translation.en: is expected March 19th.
Already, three cases have been tried in England.
translation.ko: 이미 영국에서는 세 건이 재판에 회부되었습니다

translation.en: Two on charges of arson, one on rape.
translation.ko: 두 건은 방화, 한 건은 강간이었죠

translation.en: The verdict in all cases, not guilty by reason of demonic possession.
translation.ko: 모든 사건에서 평결은 악귀 빙의로 인한 무죄였습니다

translation.en: In my 15-year journalism career,
translation.ko: "마이크 앨런 전직 보도 책임자" 15년간 저널리즘 일을 하면서

translation.en: this was by far the most bizarre story I ever covered.
translation.ko: 제가 다룬 기사 중에 가장 이상한 사건이었어요

translation.en: [newscaster] Lorraine and Ed Warren,
known as long-time students and lecturers on matters occult.
translation.ko: 초자연 현상을 오래 연구하고 강의도 해 온 것으로 알려졌죠

translation.en: The Warrens argue it was the demonic influence now inside Johnson
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부는 존슨 씨 안에 있던 악귀 때문에

translation.en: that drove him to kill.
The whole issue of demonic possession from a reporter's perspective
is… is terribly difficult.
Uh, because you, uh, cannot prove it.
You cannot disprove it.
Uh, the best you can do as a good reporter is to try and find facts.
translation.ko: 좋은 기자로서 할 수 있는 최선은 사실을 찾는 거예요

translation.en: Six days after the stabbing, I was, uh, introduced to the Warrens.
translation.ko: 칼부림 사건이 있은 지 6일 후 워런 씨 부부를 만났어요

translation.en: We had made arrangements.
They were gonna let me have some audio tapes.
And that I would be free to put these on, uh, the two radio stations
translation.ko: 제가 원한다면 라디오 방송국 두 곳에서

translation.en: if… if I wanted to do that.
[over radio] Good afternoon. This is Mike Allen.
WINE News has obtained some rather dramatic tapes
translation.ko: 다소 극적인 테이프를 저희 방송이 입수했는데요

translation.en: said to be associated with the so-called "devil made me do it" stabbing death
translation.ko: 브룩필드의 일명 '악마가 시켰다' 칼부림 살인 사건과

translation.en: in Brookfield.
[young Arne] In the name of the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit,
I command you to leave this boy.
The cross is right on your forehead. You can't hurt God's child.
translation.ko: 이마에 십자가가 있다 주님의 아이는 해치지 못한다

translation.en: [possessed David] Jesus is gonna die in hell.
-[Judy] Mommy loves you. -[possessed David growling]
[Mike] And I was anticipating that we would get a lot of phone calls
translation.ko: '이런 걸 왜 틀었느냐 정말 불쾌한 사람이다'

translation.en: from people saying, "Why did you put this on?" "You're horrendous."
But most of the phone calls were, "When are you gonna play it again?"
translation.ko: 그런데 대부분 언제 또 틀어 줄 건지 묻더군요

translation.en: I was getting mail from across the country,
uh, from psychics and… and people in the paranormal field
translation.ko: 심령 연구나 초자연 분야의 사람들이 저를 도와주겠다고 연락해 왔죠

translation.en: offering their services to me.
Then you would get to the non-believers, who are like, "Are you kidding?"
translation.ko: 물론 믿지 않는 사람들은 이랬죠 '지금 장난해요?'

translation.en: "There was drinking. There was a stabbing."
"This is an open-shut case."
"Why are you even giving this airtime? This is ridiculous."
[newscaster] On a visit to the murder site,
none of the neighbors, including a priest who was involved in the case,
translation.ko: 이 사건에 개입된 성직자를 포함한 그 어떤 주민도

translation.en: wanted to talk about it.
I did reach out to, uh, priests who were at the so-called exorcisms.
So what I said to them was, "Look, there are allegations
translation.ko: 이 의식을 진행할 때 가구가 마구 날아다니고

translation.en: that during these ceremonies, furniture was flying around the room,
that there was levitation observed."
"Uh, all I'm asking you to do is to just say, 'That's nonsense. It didn't happen.'"
translation.ko: '말도 안 된다, 그런 일 없었다' 이렇게만 말해 달라고요

translation.en: "And then we can all go on our way." They wouldn't say that.
translation.ko: 그러면 각자 갈 길 가면 된다고요 근데 그런 말을 안 하더군요

translation.en: [host] Ed, what do you say to somebody who says, "I just don't believe any of this."
translation.ko: 에드, 이런 건 하나도 못 믿겠다는 사람이 있다면 뭐라고 하실래요?

translation.en: Well, I would hope you weren't on the jury.
[Ed] We can back up this case history with numerous other case histories
translation.ko: 이걸 뒷받침해 주는 다른 사건 기록도 많아요

translation.en: which we've been involved with, and prove beyond a shadow of a doubt
translation.ko: 우리가 직접 참여했었고 초자연적 현상이 생겼다는 걸

translation.en: that preternatural phenomenon was taking place here.
translation.ko: 한 치의 의심도 없이 증명해 줍니다

translation.en: [Carl] The photos look super happy.
I mean, I can't argue with you.
But there was… a different side when those doors closed.
translation.ko: 하지만 문이 닫힌 집 안에는 다른 면이 있었어요

translation.en: I can tell you that much.
We were far from the normal, happy American family.
translation.ko: 평범하고 행복한 미국 가정과는 아주 거리가 멀었어요

translation.en: My mother had her agenda.
If things weren't going her way, she'd throw a tantrum.
translation.ko: 자기 뜻대로 안 되면 난리가 났었죠

translation.en: In front of people, she'd try to portray herself as a holy roller
translation.ko: 사람들 앞에서 자신을 독실한 교인처럼 보이려 했어요

translation.en: and all this other stuff, but that was not even close to reality.
translation.ko: 온갖 겉치레를 했지만 현실은 전혀 달랐어요

translation.en: She didn't even go to church or any of this stuff
until all this stuff with David.
And when Lorraine Warren stepped in the picture,
that's when everybody came like,
"Oh, we gotta wear scapulars. We gotta wear rosaries." And… [inhales deeply]
I wasn't buying it.
I was 15 when my brother was supposedly possessed.
translation.ko: 동생이 악귀에 씌었다고 했을 때 저는 15살이었어요

translation.en: I'd never talked before on camera or anything,
translation.ko: 카메라 앞에서든 뭐든 말한 적 한 번도 없어요

translation.en: and I just wanted the truth to come out because an innocent man got killed.
translation.ko: 진실이 밝혀지길 바랄 뿐이었죠 무고한 사람이 살해됐으니까요

translation.en: And they wanna play it off "the devil made me do it"?
translation.ko: '악마가 시킨 일이다'라는 얘기로 밀고 가려고 하지만

translation.en: It's just far from the truth. I know because I lived it.
translation.ko: 전혀 사실이 아니에요 그 속에 살았으니 제가 알아요

translation.en: I was outside, and Ed and Lorraine arrived.
translation.ko: 전 밖에 있었는데 에드와 러레인이 왔어요

translation.en: Ed Warren, he says, "What's going on here?"
And I said, "Honestly, I think my family is nuts."
translation.ko: 그래서 솔직히 우리 가족이 미쳤다고 했어요

translation.en: I remember saying that to Ed Warren.
I didn't know what Ed and Lorraine Warren's agenda was in the beginning.
translation.ko: 에드와 러레인 워런의 저의가 뭔지 처음엔 몰랐어요

translation.en: [Carl] I just sat back and watched, and things didn't sit right with me.
translation.ko: 그냥 가만히 앉아서 지켜봤는데 저랑은 안 맞더라고요

translation.en: What would you do if you were in charge?
[Carl] They'd sit down at the kitchen table to discuss David's issues.
translation.ko: 식탁 앞에 앉아서 데이비드의 문제를 상의했어요

translation.en: You don't like these things, right? -[young David] No. -No?
[Carl] They were saying,
"Well, he can start cursing at you, spitting at you."
"He'll grunt and growl like a savage."
And my concern was,
why talk about the subject when we're sitting right there?
translation.ko: 왜 우리가 앉은 그 자리에서 그런 얘길 하는가였어요

translation.en: Have the kids go outside, go downstairs, go do something.
translation.ko: 애들은 밖에 보내든 1층에 보내든 다른 걸 하게 해야죠

translation.en: But they wanted to make sure, you know, we heard it, and we did.
translation.ko: 근데 우리가 꼭 듣도록 했고 실제로 들었어요

translation.en: Like you're leading them on what to do.
[Ed] What kind of things did he do when he wasn't David?
translation.ko: 데이비드가 아닐 때 어떤 행동을 하던가요?

translation.en: -[Judy] Spit, swear, started to swear. -[Arne] He swore a lot.
translation.ko: - 침 뱉고 욕하기 시작했어요 - 욕을 많이 했어요

translation.en: -[Ed] Swear at the priest? -[Judy] And me. Yeah, a lot was directed--
[Carl] You don't think David's smart enough to put that together?
translation.ko: 데이비드가 바보도 아닌데 다 알아듣지 않겠어요?

translation.en: A couple of days later, David was doing just that,
translation.ko: 며칠 뒤에 데이비드가 딱 그렇게 하더군요

translation.en: word for word.
-[Judy] All right, son. -[possessed David] You fucking cocksucker.
translation.ko: - 그래, 아들아 - 이 거지 같은 게

translation.en: I'll penalize you!
[Judy] David, stop it. [possessed David] You goddamn deserve to die!
translation.ko: - 데이비드, 그만해 - 망할 넌 죽어도 싸!

translation.en: -You don't deserve to live! -[Judy] David. David, calm down.
[possessed David] You'll die!
You fat frigging fucking bitch.
In the beginning, the Warrens did come over a lot,
translation.ko: 처음에는 워런 씨 부부가 자주 왔었어요

translation.en: like every other day. The first week, I think, they showed up every day.
translation.ko: 이틀에 한 번꼴로 왔죠 첫 주엔 매일 왔을 거예요

translation.en: [Judy] Mommy's here. Mommy's here. Come on, wake up. Come on, get up.
translation.ko: 엄마가 여기 있어, 참아 어서 포기해

translation.en: [Carl] Every night they had the cameras ready.
-[Judy] Get out of my son. -[Carl] The microphones ready.
-[possessed David] No! No! -[Judy] I'm your mother.
[Carl] It turned into a show.
-[Judy speaking indistinctly] -[possessed David] Don't do that!
[Judy] David! Just get up! My God! Get up, come on!
translation.ko: 그만해! 어서 일어나 세상에! 어서 일어나라고!

translation.en: [Carl] Instead of focusing their energy on helping David, record him.
translation.ko: 데이비드를 돕는 데 사력을 다하기보단 녹화를 했어요

translation.en: You know, everything could've been done differently.
There was one incident one evening
that my mother was screaming at David
to stop it, and stop it and calm down, sit down.
And he started calling her everything under the sun.
translation.ko: 데이비드는 어머니에게 온갖 욕을 다 하기 시작했죠

translation.en: [possessed David] You fat frigging fucking bitch. [Carl] And all of a sudden, my father came out.
-[David] You don't deserve to live! -[Judy] David--
Get up!
You hear "slap."
[David's father] Get over there and sit down.
[Carl] He goes, "Now I said to stop."
[David's father] Enough! No more. It's got to stop.
And sure enough, the, uh, devil sat down and was very quiet.
translation.ko: 당연히 그 악마가 아주 얌전히 앉더군요

translation.en: So I'm glad at least he listens to my father.
Okay, one second. Okay, give me one…
translation.ko: 그래, 잠깐만 좋아, 한 번 더 해 봐

translation.en: [Carl] The night of the murder, my dad and I were working outside
translation.ko: 살인 사건이 있던 날 밤 아빠와 전 밖에서 일했는데

translation.en: and my mother screamed,
[Carl] "We have to get to the kennel. Something happened. Debbie's hysterical."
translation.ko: '사육소에 가야 해' '일이 생겼는데 데비가 난리 났어'

translation.en: -We have to go. -All right.
[Carl] We get there, and Debbie's like, "Oh, there was a bad fight."
translation.ko: 우리가 갔더니 누나 말이 심한 싸움이 있었대요

translation.en: "Alan got stabbed. He's over there."
translation.ko: 앨런이 칼에 찔렸는데 저기 있다고 하더군요

translation.en: I saw Alan laying on his side. That's when I went over to him and rolled him over.
translation.ko: 앨런이 옆으로 누워 있었어요 제가 가서 똑바로 눕혔죠

translation.en: Keep in mind, I'm 15 or…
I don't know what to do. I never had to deal with this in my life.
translation.ko: 어떻게 할지 모르겠더군요 평생 그런 일은 처음이었죠

translation.en: And I remember seeing the four stab wounds. Um, it was four.
translation.ko: 네 군데에 자상이 생긴 걸 봤어요 네 군데였어요

translation.en: He was gasping for air. I just kept telling him, "Alan, hold on."
translation.ko: 숨을 헐떡이고 있었고 전 계속 그랬죠, '앨런, 버텨요'

translation.en: So, you know, what are you gonna do?
It's like you're, you know, you're… you're stuck.
translation.ko: 꼼짝 못 하고 얼어붙은 것 같았죠

translation.en: You know what I'm saying? It's just, uh…
It's not a feeling I like to-- You know, I don't even talk about it, to be honest.
translation.ko: 그때 기분은 별로… 솔직히 말하기도 싫어요

translation.en: It's something I don't want to remember, because it was just something--
translation.ko: 기억하고 싶지 않은 부분이에요 그건 정말이지…

translation.en: You can't help somebody. You know, it's like… there was nothing I could do.
translation.ko: 누군가를 도울 수 있는 게 아무것도 없는 상황이었죠

translation.en: It's just sad to see somebody die like that.
translation.ko: 누가 그렇게 죽는 걸 보다니 슬플 뿐이에요

translation.en: The murder of Alan Bono,
I never even thought it was connected to David.
There's nothing demonic in this.
translation.ko: 여긴 악마 같은 부분이 전혀 없었어요

translation.en: Arne was very possessive of Debbie.
translation.ko: 아니는 데비 누나에 대한 소유욕이 심했어요

translation.en: There was speculations and rumors that Debbie was having an affair with Alan Bono.
translation.ko: 데비 누나가 앨런 보노와 바람을 피운다는 얘기도 있었죠

translation.en: [Glenn] I remember Debbie Glatzel came to the police department,
and she said, "You know, I'm hearing rumor
that this murder was o-over a three-way,
translation.ko: 세 명이 즐기다 생겼다는 소문을 들었대요

translation.en: a triangle between myself and Alan Bono, uh, with Arne Cheyenne Johnson."
translation.ko: 앨런 보노와 아니 샤이엔 존슨 자기의 삼각관계 때문이라고요

translation.en: And she says, "It wasn't." She says, "I had a relationship with Alan Bono."
translation.ko: 그런 거 아니라면서 앨런 보노와 사귀긴 했지만

translation.en: "That's over with, and this… this stabbing, this murder had nothing to do with that."
translation.ko: 이미 끝난 일이고 이 칼부림, 살인과는 무관하대요

translation.en: A bizarre murder trial gets underway tomorrow in Danbury, Connecticut.
translation.ko: 내일 코네티컷주 댄버리에서 기묘한 살인 사건 재판이 열립니다

translation.en: The crux of this case is a claim of demonic possession.
translation.ko: 이 사건의 핵심은 바로 악귀에 씌었다는 주장이죠

translation.en: Jim Van Sickle reports.
[Jim] Will the devil be present in this ancient courthouse
translation.ko: 내일 코네티컷주 댄버리의 이 오래된 법정에

translation.en: in Danbury, Connecticut tomorrow?
Might he take the stand at some point?
[Carl] I did not know that the trial was beginning.
And on the first day of the trial, my parents actually gave me money
translation.ko: 재판 첫날 부모님이 저에게 돈을 주시면서

translation.en: just so I can basically skip school and go do what I want to do for the day.
translation.ko: 학교에 가지 말고 하루 동안 하고 싶은 걸 하랬어요

translation.en: They were petrified of me getting involved in the story,
translation.ko: 제가 이 이야기에 연루될까 봐 너무 두려워하셨죠

translation.en: because I knew…
this is all fabricated.
[Alan] We, as a family, thought Arne would be found innocent
translation.ko: 우리 가족은 아니가 무죄를 받을 거라고 생각했어요

translation.en: because we were going to have the priest
and the Warrens and all the evidence we gathered,
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부도 있고 음성 녹음, 사진 등 우리가 모은 증거도 있으니

translation.en: the audio recordings, the photographs,
translation.ko: 음성 녹음, 사진 등 우리가 모은 증거도 있으니

translation.en: and be able to show the court Arne did not commit murder,
translation.ko: 아니가 살해한 게 아니라는 걸 법정에 보일 수 있을 테니까요

translation.en: um, he was possessed 'cause he challenged the beast.
translation.ko: 악귀를 도발했기 때문에 악귀에 씐 거예요

translation.en: The prosecution was pushing for a maximum sentence
for a guilty conviction.
This is a case which, uh, the media has
and the Warrens have, uh, spent a good deal of time publicizing,
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부가 자신의 금전적인 이득을 위해

translation.en: uh, for their own, I would suspect, financial interest.
But as far as I am concerned, this is a, uh, routine,
translation.ko: 하지만 제가 보기에 이건 보통의 사건이에요

translation.en: to the extent it's possible to have a routine homicide.
To come out and say this was just a bunch of baloney,
that we were trying to cover up just a simple murder case.
translation.ko: 단순 살인 사건을 은폐하려는 거라는 둥 그랬죠

translation.en: If Arne had been convicted of murder, he was facing 25 to life.
translation.ko: 아니가 살인으로 유죄를 받으면 25년 형에서 종신형이었어요

translation.en: -[suspenseful music playing] -[cameras clicking]
Getting inside the courthouse was extremely difficult.
translation.ko: 법원 안에 들어가는 건 정말 힘들었어요

translation.en: It was standing room only.
translation.ko: 자리가 전부 꽉 차서 서서 봐야 했죠

translation.en: Nobody knew what exactly to expect.
translation.ko: 어떤 일이 생길지 아무도 예상 못 했어요

translation.en: It was almost like a… a showdown was going to occur
with Martin Minnella coming in with this demonic possession defense,
translation.ko: 마틴 미넬라가 악귀 빙의라는 변호를 펼치고

translation.en: and Judge Robert Callahan having to make a ruling
translation.ko: 로버트 캘러핸 판사는 그걸 인정할지를 두고

translation.en: on whether he was going to admit it or not.
It was a reality check, to be honest with you.
Here I was, in court. Never been there before.
translation.ko: 평생 와 본 적 없는 법정에 와서는

translation.en: Facing 25 to life.
And it was, uh, surreal. Mmm.
[Martin] I believed that my client was going to get his day in court.
translation.ko: 제 의뢰인의 변론을 할 기회가 있을 거라고 믿었어요

translation.en: Let the jury evaluate the credibility of what occurred.
translation.ko: 그 일의 신뢰성은 배심원단이 판단할 일이죠

translation.en: Not just believe in faith,
believe in actual physical evidence and testimony,
translation.ko: 실제 물리적인 증거와 증언을 믿고 그걸 바탕으로

translation.en: and then make their mind up based on this.
But it never got that far.
The judge listened to precedence, to arguments, and then he said
that demonic possession is not an acceptable defense.
translation.ko: 악귀 빙의라는 변호는 받아들일 수 없다고 했습니다

translation.en: It is irrelevant in this case and in courts in the United States.
translation.ko: 이 사건과 미국 법정에서는 무관한 내용이라고 했으며

translation.en: It is not a science,
and he will permit no evidence on demonic possession and devils.
translation.ko: 악귀 빙의나 악마에 관한 증거는 허락하지 않겠다고 했습니다

translation.en: Jim Van Sickle, News 4, Danbury.
I was devastated.
And you can hear all the sighs from the family. Like, "Oh my God."
In court, you had to put your hand on the Bible and swear on the Bible.
translation.ko: 법정에서 성경에 손을 대고 맹세해야 했어요

translation.en: But that's okay. But other than that,
translation.ko: 그건 괜찮다면서 그 외의 초자연적 존재나 악귀는 믿지 않아요

translation.en: they don't believe anything in… in supernatural or… or the devil.
translation.ko: 그 외의 초자연적 존재나 악귀는 믿지 않아요

translation.en: So how does that work?
Right in front of me,
the five or six Catholic priests who were there got up in unison,
translation.ko: 가톨릭교 신부님 대여섯 명이 일제히 일어나더니

translation.en: it was almost like it was rehearsed,
and marched out, never to be heard from again.
translation.ko: 밖으로 나갔고 그 후 어떤 소식도 듣지 못했죠

translation.en: And the church didn't comment on this case, uh, going forward.
translation.ko: 그 이후로 가톨릭교회 측은 어떤 코멘트도 하지 않았어요

translation.en: [Arne] I felt abandoned.
Didn't have the chance to tell the whole truth.
But they would never allow the truth, so… felt lost.
translation.ko: 진실을 받아주지 않은 거니 어떻게 할지 몰랐어요

translation.en: Wha-- What do we do now?
The trial in Danbury resumes tomorrow.
It became a very difficult case then for the defense to argue
translation.ko: 피고인 측이 변호하는 것이 정말 힘들어졌어요

translation.en: because you had the signed statements with the police of his sisters,
translation.ko: 여동생들이 아니가 앨런을 칼로 찌르는 걸 봤다고 하는

translation.en: who said they saw Arne stab Alan.
And if you couldn't say, "Yeah, but he did that
translation.ko: 하지만 악귀에 씌었기 때문에 그랬다는 말은 못 하게 됐으니

translation.en: because of demonic possession," uh, you're left with, "He stabbed him."
translation.ko: 하지만 악귀에 씌었기 때문에 그랬다는 말은 못 하게 됐으니 '칼로 찔렀다'만 남게 됐어요

translation.en: Martin Minnella told me that the only thing we can really go for is self-defense.
translation.ko: 마틴 미넬라는 정당방위로 가는 수밖에 없다고 했어요

translation.en: And he goes, "That's the plea we're going to present."
Not guilty of murder in the first degree. Manslaughter.
The problem is, self-defense isn't retaliation.
In other words, if somebody came at you,
you might stab him once, maybe twice, but not a number of times.
translation.ko: 한두 번은 찌르겠지만 여러 번 찌르진 않거든요

translation.en: Because if you do that,
self-defense goes out the window.
To suddenly say that it was self-defense,
when it wasn't put forward as that at the beginning,
um, certainly seemed unusual.
That was the only way that I would have a chance
not to get 25 to life.
I had to take the stand.
It was kind of difficult to take the stand
because I really didn't remember what happened.
translation.ko: 그때 일이 전혀 기억 안 났거든요

translation.en: And that's what I told them.
I think everybody felt
this was just a very unfortunate story on so many different levels.
translation.ko: 정말 안타까운 일이었다고 다들 느낀 것 같아요

translation.en: But at the same time, there was somebody who was dead
and somebody who had caused that death, and justice had to be done.
translation.ko: 그 죽음을 야기한 사람이 있다면 정의는 구현되어야 하죠

translation.en: [David] There was tension in the family.
My sister was… was horrified that he was gonna be convicted of murder,
translation.ko: 아니가 살인으로 유죄를 받아서 종신형을 받을까 봐

translation.en: and he'd spend the rest of his life in jail.
I was brought up to the courtroom. The room was filled.
translation.ko: 법정으로 안내받아 갔는데 법정이 꽉 찼더군요

translation.en: The judge came, and he got the verdict from the foreman of the jury.
I was very nervous and terrified.
The verdict was not guilty of murder in the first degree,
guilty of manslaughter in the first degree.
Then we came to sentencing.
I remember Judge Callahan's words to this day.
"I have no alternative but to give you the maximum sentence allowed."
"Ten to 20 years to a maximum-security prison."
When I was handed the sentence, Debbie jumped up and told the judge,
translation.ko: 형을 선고받았을 때 데비가 벌떡 일어나 말했어요

translation.en: "Callahan," she goes, "you're sick. You're insane."
And then she just went running, crying.
When I was exiting the courthouse,
Debbie broke through the camera people, ran up to me to give me a kiss.
translation.ko: 데비가 카메라맨들을 뚫고 저에게 달려와 키스했어요 "악마 연인들"

translation.en: And I told Debbie, I said, "I want you to go live your life
translation.ko: 전 데비에게 그랬어요 '가서 네 인생 살아'

translation.en: 'cause I don't know what's gonna happen with mine."
"This way you still have a life."
She started to cry. She goes, "You don't love me."
translation.ko: 그랬더니 울면서 내가 자길 사랑하지 않는대요

translation.en: I said, "I do love you. That's why I'm giving you freedom."
translation.ko: 저는 널 사랑하지만 그래서 자유를 주는 거라고 했어요

translation.en: She goes, "No, I will never leave you."
I've always said it from the beginning.
Arne's innocent.
He's been to hell and back.
[Alan] My mom was very upset about it.
She knew that he was under demonic possession.
He was a non-violent person.
She felt horrible for Arne.
-[dial tone] -My mom wanted the story told.
translation.ko: 엄마는 이야기를 널리 알리고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: She wanted to tell the truth, and wanted people to know what was going on.
translation.ko: 무슨 상황인지 진실을 말하고 사람들에게 알리고 싶어 했죠

translation.en: Seated next to me is a mother of a once-possessed child,
translation.ko: 제 옆에 앉은 분은 악귀에 씌었던 아이의 어머니로

translation.en: and she's here to share with us her story.
-How do you do? -[host] Nice to have you.
Tell me how David is today.
Well, he's not possessed anymore. He's out of possession.
Right. Totally normal?
Totally normal, and, um… [inhales deeply]
Arne still has a lot of problems.
Here's a young man who is now in prison.
He is serving a ten- to 20-year sentence for manslaughter
for something he really is not responsible for.
After the trial, my mother ended up going to… Hollywood.
translation.ko: 재판이 끝나고 엄마는 결국 할리우드로 갔어요

translation.en: We all flew on a jet.
translation.ko: 우리 모두 전용 비행기를 타고 갔죠

translation.en: We got picked up in a limo and go on to dinner with Dick Clark.
translation.ko: 리무진을 타고 가서 딕 클라크와 저녁을 먹었어요

translation.en: She was enjoying it. She was very excited,
translation.ko: 엄마는 즐기고 있었어요 많이 들떠 있었죠

translation.en: and she couldn't believe this was happening to her.
translation.ko: 이런 일이 생기다니 못 믿겠다고 하셨어요

translation.en: But Ed and Lorraine Warren had an agenda.
translation.ko: 하지만 에드와 러레인에게는 숨은 의도가 있었어요

translation.en: They said, "You guys will be millionaires."
The Warrens told me that they were gonna do a book.
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부가 책을 쓸 거라고 하더군요

translation.en: They already had the author lined up,
which I guess he did a previous book for them.
They brought Mr. Brittle up to talk with us,
translation.ko: 우리와 얘기할 수 있도록 브리틀 씨를 데려왔어요

translation.en: and they asked a… a bunch of questions. Ed said, "Make it scary."
translation.ko: 이것저것 질문을 많이 했죠 에드는 무섭게 만들라고 하더군요

translation.en: He goes, "But I checked with the people, and they said this didn't happen."
translation.ko: 브리틀 씨는 자기가 확인해 봤는데 그런 일 없었다더라고 했죠

translation.en: Ed goes, "Make it scary. People come to us. They buy scary."
translation.ko: 에드는 무섭게 만들라면서 자기에게 오는 사람들은 무서운 걸 좋아한대요

translation.en: Ed and Lorraine Warren took over.
Six months later, the Warrens show up with paperwork,
translation.ko: 6개월 후 워런 씨 부부가 서류를 가지고 나타났어요

translation.en: and my mom's like, "Should we get a lawyer?"
And Lorraine's like, "No, dear."
"William Morris Agency has a whole floor of lawyers."
translation.ko: 윌리엄 모리스 출판사에 변호사가 차고 넘친대요

translation.en: Yes, they do. But it's not for them. It's for youse.
translation.ko: 네, 그것도 사실이지만 엄마를 위한 게 아니라 그 사람들을 위한 변호사죠

translation.en: -[Lorraine] Hello. -Hi, Lorraine? Judy.
-Hi, Judy. -[Judy] How you doing?
[Lorraine] Good, dear.
-[Judy] Did you find out anything yet? -What, honey?
-[Judy] About the book or anything? -[Lorraine] Everything is great.
[Judy] Okay, good.
Because youse put so much work into this. We went through all the tragedy.
translation.ko: 공을 많이 들이셨잖아요 우리가 온갖 비극을 다 겪었죠

translation.en: And I'll tell you, we need the money just like you do.
[Carl] My mother and father received $4,500,
but Ed and Lorraine Warren received $81,000 and some change.
translation.ko: 근데 에드와 러레인 워런은 81,000달러 이상을 받았죠

translation.en: They're still making money on it with the Conjuring films.
[David] Lorraine told me I was gonna be a rich little boy
translation.ko: "컨저링 3: 악마가 시켰다" 러레인은 이 도서 계약으로 내가 부자가 될 거랬어요

translation.en: from having this book deal.
translation.ko: 러레인은 이 도서 계약으로 내가 부자가 될 거랬어요

translation.en: And that was a lie.
The Warrens made a lot of money off of us.
translation.ko: 워런 씨 부부는 우리를 이용해서 돈을 많이 벌었어요

translation.en: If they can profit off you, they will.
translation.ko: 돈이 되는 기회가 있다면 사람을 이용할 자들이에요

translation.en: They're not gonna pass up that deal.
translation.ko: 그 거래의 기회를 놓치지 않을 거예요

translation.en: [Carl] When my mother realized that she was getting, as she calls it, hoodwinked,
translation.ko: 어머니가 얼마를 받는지 알게 됐을 때 속았다고 하셨어요

translation.en: she lost faith in them.
They were good at what they did,
and they knew how to talk to people and knew how to play people.
translation.ko: 사람들에게 말하는 법과 이용하는 법을 잘 알았죠

translation.en: They were very good con people.
[Alan] My brother David felt guilty over the whole ordeal.
translation.ko: 제 동생 데이비드는 이 일로 죄책감을 느꼈어요

translation.en: [sighs] Heartbroken, actually, 'cause he knew that Arne was innocent.
translation.ko: 아니가 무고하다는 걸 알았으니 사실 마음 아파했죠

translation.en: I could've never made it through this time without Debbie's support.
translation.ko: 데비가 옆에 있지 않았다면 이 시간을 못 견뎠을 거예요

translation.en: The support gave me hope.
Then, in 1985,
we actually were married in the prison.
She looked real beautiful. She was radiant.
I couldn't wait to hold her. It was great.
This whole thing changed my life, brought me more to religion.
translation.ko: 이 모든 일로 인생이 바뀌었어요 종교에 더 가까워졌죠

translation.en: I am not possessed.
I never had an exorcism,
but I'm not possessed, and I know how to protect myself.
translation.ko: 악귀에 씌진 않았고 저를 보호하는 법도 알아요

translation.en: I know what prayers to say, so I'm very much in control.
translation.ko: 무슨 기도를 할지도 알아요 그러니 나 자신에게 통제권이 있어요

translation.en: My faith keeps me strong.
So everything seems to be fine. Life is moving forward.
translation.ko: 다 괜찮은 것 같아요 앞으로 계속 나아가고 있죠

translation.en: I think this whole case affected the entire family.
translation.ko: 이 사건이 가족 전체에 영향을 준 것 같아요

translation.en: It scarred everybody.
It's twisted all of our lives upside down, and it's difficult to talk about.
translation.ko: 우리 인생을 송두리째 흔들었고 그 얘기를 하는 게 어려워요

translation.en: It's been over 40 years…
…but it changed us
and has had long-lasting effects on everyone in the family.
translation.ko: 우리 가족 모두에게 큰 영향을 주었어요

translation.en: We're at the point where we're basically all scattered.
You know, none of us really talk no more.
[David] Seeing the pictures…
they make me scared again and very sad, because there's an 11-year-old boy
translation.ko: 또 무섭고 슬퍼져요 평범하게 살던 11살 소년이

translation.en: having a normal childhood until this happened.
I gotta deal with it every day.
Well, this story, you want to know who's telling the truth.
translation.ko: 이 이야기에서 누구 말이 진실인지 궁금하시겠죠

translation.en: After my parents died, my wife and I were going through their belongings.
translation.ko: 부모님이 돌아가신 후 아내와 제가 유품을 정리했어요

translation.en: My mother wrote down everything. She had OCD.
translation.ko: 어머니는 강박증이 있어서 전부 적어 두셨어요

translation.en: It'd be on a piece of paper, a calendar, or whatever. She'd write notes down.
translation.ko: 종이쪽지, 달력 등 어디든 메모를 써 두곤 하셨죠

translation.en: On this one note, it said,
"Well, the family had their medicine tonight, and everything was good."
translation.ko: '오늘 밤 가족들이 약을 먹었고 전부 다 괜찮았다'

translation.en: As we looked into things,
we realized there's more to this medicine.
We found out that she was putting Sominex in our food.
And she's been giving it to the whole family for quite a long time.
translation.ko: 오랫동안 가족 전체에게 그 약을 준 거죠

translation.en: [ad narrator] Some people can fall asleep anyplace.
But did simple tension keep you awake last night?
translation.ko: 하지만 별거 아닌 긴장으로 어젯밤 잠을 설쳤나요?

translation.en: Take Sominex tonight and sleep. Sominex is absolutely not habit-forming.
translation.ko: 소미넥스를 먹고 주무세요 절대 중독되진 않습니다

translation.en: Just take two Sominex tablets as directed for 100% safe sleep and wake up refreshed.
translation.ko: 설명서에 따라 소미넥스 두 알을 드시고 100% 안전한 수면 후 상쾌한 아침을 맞으세요

translation.en: I remember my mother serving us dinner. Her bowl was always separate from ours.
translation.ko: 엄마가 우리에게 저녁을 주셨는데 늘 엄마 그릇은 따로 있었어요

translation.en: So if she had spaghetti, everybody eats out of the bowl.
translation.ko: 스파게티를 만들면 다들 큰 그릇에서 떠서 먹었어요

translation.en: She'd have hers separate. It's like, "Want more?" She goes, "No, I'm good."
translation.ko: 엄마 거는 늘 따로 있었고 더 드시겠냐고 하면 사양하셨죠

translation.en: I believe my mother used Sominex to control all us boys and my dad.
translation.ko: 엄마가 소미넥스로 아들들과 아빠를 조종했던 것 같아요

translation.en: At the end of the day, if everybody's tired and exhausted,
guess what? Everybody's gonna rest and sit down. There's no more problems.
translation.ko: 어쩌겠어요? 그냥 앉아서 쉴 테니 아무 문제가 없겠죠

translation.en: But Sominex has long-lasting effects on people.
translation.ko: 하지만 소미넥스는 장기 복용 시 부작용이 있어요

translation.en: Mood swings, weight gain, and hallucinations.
translation.ko: 감정 기복, 체중 증가 환각 등이죠

translation.en: [Carl] It is very possible
that my brother David has ingested enough of this stuff over the years,
translation.ko: 몇 년 동안 이걸 많이 복용해서

translation.en: where he did see things.
[possessed David] I'll kill you.
Jesus is going to die in hell.
[Carl] Or at least he thought he saw things.
[possessed David] I'll murder you, you bastard.
[Carl] Between David, Arne, my brother Alan…
They were all victims at the end of the day.
My… My mother would not drug the family.
translation.ko: 엄마가 가족들에게 약을 먹이진 않았을 거예요

translation.en: My mom took good care of us.
The truth is, when I was 11 years old,
I was possessed by a demonic spirit, I guess you can call it.
translation.ko: 악귀에 씌었어요 그렇다고 볼 수 있겠죠

translation.en: That's what the truth is. I have no reason to lie about anything.
translation.ko: 그게 사실이에요 거짓말을 할 이유가 없어요

translation.en: I guess, like my dad, I go buy a piece of junk and I fix it.
Just stay occupied. Just stay busy.
Because idle hands make the devil's work.
translation.ko: 할 일 없는 자들이 사악한 짓을 하는 법이니까요
